cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SE of St. Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the Greater Antilles this weekend, forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico early next week and curve northwest toward the upper Texas / south-west Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border (upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Current watches limited to Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic, Haiti and southeastern Bahamas (none yet along U.S. Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Current warnings limited to Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic, Haiti and southeastern Bahamas (none yet along U.S. Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama is within the day-4/5 cone of uncertainty
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) are possible at Beaumont mid-week with current cumulative probability 7% and increasing if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If LAURA makes landfall near the TX-LA border, surge of 3–6 ft above ground level is possible in Sabine Lake and adjacent coastal areas affecting port approaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches possible 26–27 Aug, creating flood and drainage issues at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat in outer rain-bands; elevated seas and wave action in the Sabine/Neches ship channels may halt pilotage.
